overview_summary: The adjacent landowners in Headrick are a mix of absentee land investment entities and long-time local farming interests. Two corporate owners (Howco, Inc. and Flying B Land & Cattle Co., LLC) are operated from outside the community and appear primarily motivated by land or mineral investment returns. In contrast, the Pamela Roudebush Living Trust and AFL Farms LLC represent established local agricultural families with deep roots in the area, likely valuing the continuation of farming and community ties. One entity (JEH, LLC) remains opaque, suggesting a passive holding with no visible community role or stated development stance.

neighbors.name: Howco, Inc.
neighbors.claims: Howco, Inc. appears to be involved in oil and gas operations, with a listed contact address at 517 W 5th St in Stroud, Oklahoma ([www.shalexp.com](https://www.shalexp.com/howco-oil-and-gas#:~:text=Address%20%20%7C%20Phone%20,0945)). It operated oil/gas wells in Oklahoma from the late 1990s through around 2015 ([www.shalexp.com](https://www.shalexp.com/howco-oil-and-gas#:~:text=match%20at%20L25%20gas%20production,Oct%201998%20to%20Mar%202015)). No information on local presence or personnel is publicly available; its beneficial owners are not disclosed (likely a private investor holding).
neighbors.influence_justification: Absentee corporate owner with no local presence or community engagement; limited to land/mineral ownership

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify Howco’s principal (via its Stroud contact) and emphasize a financial incentive (e.g., premium purchase or lease). As an absentee investor, they are likely responsive to clear economic benefits and assurances their mineral interests or land value will be protected.

neighbors.name: Flying B Land & Cattle Co. LLC
neighbors.claims: Flying B Grain & Cattle Co., LLC (presumed the same as Flying B Land & Cattle Co.) was formed in Oklahoma on January 18, 2008 by Terry J. Barker, with its organizer’s address in Tulsa ([businessprofiles.com](https://businessprofiles.com/details/flying-b-grain-cattle-co-llc/OK-3512167393#:~:text=FLYING%20,200%2C%20TULSA%20OK%2074136%201242)). The company’s name indicates farming operations (grain and cattle), but it has no known facilities in Jackson County – its management is based out-of-area ([businessprofiles.com](https://businessprofiles.com/details/flying-b-grain-cattle-co-llc/OK-3512167393#:~:text=FLYING%20,200%2C%20TULSA%20OK%2074136%201242)). No local political or community activities are noted for this entity, suggesting it functions purely as a farm/ranch investment holding by its owner.
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-area investor; owns farmland but not engaged in local affairs; limited local network

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Terry J. Barker (managing member) via his Tulsa office, highlighting guaranteed lease revenue or a buyout offer. As an absentee landowner, he is likely motivated by financial returns; addressing any cattle operation concerns and offering favorable terms could secure his cooperation or neutrality.

neighbors.name: The Pamela A. Roudebush Living Trust
neighbors.claims: Robert “Roudy” Roudebush farmed and ranched in Jackson County for over fifty years ([www.lowell-tims.com](https://www.lowell-tims.com/obituaries/Robert-Earl-Roudebush?obId=2901927#:~:text=school%20to%20take%20over%20the,s%20Coop%2C%20Cotton)). He also served on the boards of the local farmers’ cooperative, the cotton gin, and the Lugert-Altus Irrigation District ([www.lowell-tims.com](https://www.lowell-tims.com/obituaries/Robert-Earl-Roudebush?obId=2901927#:~:text=fifty%20years%2C%20Roudy%20has%20farmed%2C,was%20also%20a%20former%20member)), underscoring the family’s long-standing influence in the farming community. After Roudy’s passing in 2014, his wife Pamela (“Pam”) Roudebush remained at the family homestead in Altus ([www.lowell-tims.com](https://www.lowell-tims.com/obituaries/Robert-Earl-Roudebush?obId=2901927#:~:text=Preceded%20in%20death%20by%20his,nine%20grandchildren%2C%20Reagin%20Roudebush%2C%20Danaca)). The Pamela A. Roudebush Living Trust now holds the family’s land; this trust represents the multi-generation local farm estate (specific trust details are private).
neighbors.influence_justification: Long-standing local farm family; well-connected in agricultural circles (co-op and irrigation board)

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the Roudebush family with respect and transparency. Engage Pamela Roudebush (and/or her adult children who may manage the trust) in dialogue emphasizing how the development can co-exist with farming and benefit the local community; addressing their concerns about land and heritage will be key to gaining support or acceptance.

neighbors.name: AFL Farms, LLC
neighbors.claims: AFL Farms LLC has been active in the local farming community for over nine years ([farmlovers.org](https://farmlovers.org/supplier/afl-farms-llc/251#:~:text=An%20LLC%20that%20has%20been,the%20states%20and%20outside%20continents)). It is a small Altus-based farming operation classified under “All Other Miscellaneous Crop Farming” (NAICS 111998) with approximately three employees ([naicslist.com](https://naicslist.com/company-profile/afl-farms-llc-altus-ok-73521#:~:text=Afl%20Farms%20Llc%20is%20a,and%20has%20approximately%203%20employees)). The company’s registered address is 517 Buena Vista St, Altus, Oklahoma ([naicslist.com](https://naicslist.com/company-profile/afl-farms-llc-altus-ok-73521#:~:text=,OKLAHOMA)), indicating it is locally operated. There are no notable public records of political or development involvement by AFL Farms; it appears focused on its crop farming business without outward advocacy, implying its stance will hinge on practical impacts to its farm income and operations.
neighbors.influence_justification: Small family-run farm; limited economic reach and no known political activity outside farming

approach_recommendations.engage: Meet directly with the owners of AFL Farms LLC in Altus to discuss the project’s benefits. Emphasize practical incentives (such as improved infrastructure or direct lease payments) and reassure them that any development will not impede their farming operations. Building a personal rapport and understanding their farm needs will help in securing their neutrality or support.

neighbors.name: JEH, LLC
neighbors.claims: JEH, LLC is an opaque Oklahoma-registered entity with no public profile or disclosed principals. (Notably, a similarly named JEH, Inc. was formed in 1985 by a John Henry in Oklahoma City ([businessprofiles.com](https://businessprofiles.com/details/jeh-inc/OK-1900436280#:~:text=Business%20Profile%20Image%20,Type%3A%20Domestic)), but it is unclear if there is any relation.) No news, filings, or records were found to detail JEH, LLC’s ownership or operations; it appears to be a private land-holding vehicle. Its involvement in the community is not evident, and it has not publicly stated any position on local development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Ownership and local ties are unclear; no visible engagement or information to assess influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Further research is needed to identify the decision-maker behind JEH, LLC. Once a contact is established, approach them with a clear financial proposition (e.g., buyout or lease terms) as they likely view the land purely as an investment. Since their priorities are not publicly known, ensuring confidentiality and addressing any risk concerns will be important in discussions.
